wikipedia_page.main: Phillip Scott Burge,  (29 March 1895 – 24 July 1918) was a First World War fighter pilot and flying ace. He was killed in action over France in 1918 after earning the Military Cross.

response: Althorne was home to Phillip Scott Burge who was one of the top British fighter aces in World War I with 11 enemy kills between March and July 1918. He was killed when he was shot down over Seclin, France on 24 July 1918.
* Phillip Scott Burge, World War I flying ace KIA
*Phillip Scott Burge, MC (1895–1918), First World War fighter pilot and flying ace
